Class ChessPiece

java.lang.Object
  ChessPiece

public class ChessPiece
extends java.lang.Object

This class can store a chess piece. It knows about its dimensions, its position on the board, its kind and its side.

Version:
$Id: ChessPiece.java,v 1.5 2003/04/16 10:04:15 mtjspaan Exp $
Author:
Nikos Massios, Matthijs Spaan

Field Detail

height

public double height
This is the height of the chess piece. It is measured in mm.

diameter

public double diameter
This is the diameter of the chess piece. It is measured in mm.

location

public BoardLocation location
This is the location of the chess piece on the board. The possible range for row and column is (0-7)

side

public java.lang.String side
This is the side of the chess piece. It can either be "black" or "white".

kind

public java.lang.String kind
This is the kind of the chess piece. It can either be: "pawn", "rook", "knight", "bishop", "queen" or "king".

Constructor Detail

ChessPiece

public ChessPiece(java.lang.String kind,
                  java.lang.String side,
                  int column,
                  int row)
This constructor uses its arguments to initialise all class fields. The height and diameter fields are set automatically.

Parameters:
kind - The kind of the chess piece.
side - The side of the chess piece.
column - The column of the chess piece.
row - The row of the chess piece.
See Also:
kind, side, location, height, diameter
Method Detail

isAt

public boolean isAt(int column,
                    int row)
This method checks if the point is at the board location specified by its arguments.

Parameters:
column - The column of the board location to check.
row - The row of the board location to check.
Returns:
True if the piece is at the speicified board location and False otherwise.

isAt

public boolean isAt(BoardLocation location)
This method checks if the point is at the board location specified by its argument.

Parameters:
location - The board location to check.
Returns:
True if the piece is at the speicified board location and False otherwise.

getCol

public int getCol()
This method returns the column of the location a chess piece.

Returns:
The column of the chess piece.

getRow

public int getRow()
This method returns the row of the location a chess piece.

Returns:
The row of the chess piece.

toChar

public char toChar()
This method converts the chessPiece to a character.

Returns:
A Character representing the piece. 'p' is a pawn, 'r' is a rook, 'n' is knight, 'b' is a bishop 'q' is a queen and 'k' is a king. Lowercase characters are used for white pieces and Uppercase characters are used for black pieces.
